fields.description: VCU shall communicate on both CAN1 and CAN2 acting as a gateway between two lines. On CAN1 it shall communicate with the BMS, On Board Charger and Data Logger while on CAN2 with the Coil Driver, FLCU and Display. CAN1 250 kbps, CAN2 500 kbps. VCU shall also acquire distributed analog sensor signals.
VCU messages shall be sent via CAN exactly as defined in the latest Customer vx.x.dbc.
All VCU analogue and digital I/O shall follow the latest VCU Pinout x.x.xlsx.
Key input on pin 207 powers the VCU on and wakes other ECUs; Key Off turns the VCU off.
TBD
VCU shall forward CAN1 signals onto CAN2; it shall relay BMS data to the display and commands for the Coil Driver.
VCU shall acquire motor temperature via a PTC on pin 103 and transmit the value on CAN2 signal VCU VEHICLE INFO MotorTemp.
VCU drives pin 102 HIGH at Key On and LOW at Key Off to power the BMS.
VCU shall implement a communication timeout while talking to the BMS.
If BMS timeout occurs, VCU shall inhibit battery discharge and stop requesting energy absorption.
VCU reads BMS status word 1 to detect errors and sends a notification to the display.
VCU shall compute SoC by integrating state of health, temperature and current data.
If undervoltage occurs at zero speed, VCU restarts the BMS and forces recharge only mode.
If key on, not charging, vehicle stopped and throttle 0 for 10 min, VCU raises the BMS deactivation flag; otherwise the timer resets.
During Charging Phase VCU always commands Neutral on CAN, preventing gear selection.
Vehicle enters Charging Phase when CB CHARGING.Charging phase 1 or PlugDetection TRUE.
VCU reads BMS status word 2 for warnings and sends appropriate messages to the display.
VCU uses BMS FRAME 4 kwh ds to calculate Wh/km between two samples.
VCU receives motor RPM from Coil Driver on CAN2 PGN 64372 MG1IS1 .
engine rev 7.13 wheel rev.
VCU transmits computed speed on CAN2 signal VCU VEHICLE INFO VehicleSpeed.
VCU calculates partial and total distance and sends both on CAN2.
Trip distance derived from vehicle speed using correction factors.
VCU allows user reset of partial distance counter.
Total distance stored in EEPROM and cannot be cleared by the user.
Valid modes: Neutral, Forward, Reverse.
VCU sends EvGear and receives EvGearResp from Coil Driver.
Parking mode is not included in this project.
Sequence of ReadyToStart / PressBrakeStart indicator behaviour at key on and brake press.
Shift D R allowed via Neutral below 4 km/h; disabled above 6 km/h.
Neutral equals zero torque request to the inverter.
VCU issues DRL, position, low/high beam, passing, indicators, hazard, night sensor and welcome animation commands via VCU COMMAND LIGHTS; FLCU returns status via FLCU STATUS.
FLCU sends FLCU ERROR flcu status 1 and cycles through active error codes via FLCU ERROR total actual errors.
On failure FLCU disables affected function and logs the error for a defined time.
Two 0–5 V sensors on pins 106 and 129 provide acceleration input.
VCU sends pedal percentage on CAN2 signal VcuTorqueSpeedThrottleRequest.ThrottleRequest.
VCU verifies that the ratio of the two sensor readings stays within a valid range.
If readings consistent, throttle signal is weighted average of both sensors.
If inconsistent, throttle equals the higher value sensor.
If one sensor faulty throttle equals the other; if both faulty throttle set to 0.
Incoherent potentiometer readings raise an error flag and activate downgrade.
Brake detected by 4.5 kΩ pull up digital input on pin 178.
Regen triggered by throttle release or brake pedal, only if battery can receive charge.
Throttle set to −20 % until motor RPM 0 then 0 %; resumes when pedal pressed again.
Throttle set to −50 % until motor RPM 0 then 0 %; resumes when pedal pressed again.
Power On Standby Torque Control transitions with CAN mode requests/feedback as defined.
At Key Off VCU deactivates pin 150 and disconnects Coil Driver from BMS.
VCU receives FaultCode via InvFault1 and InvFault2 messages.
VCU receives BMS over/under temperature error bits from BMS FRAME 1.
VCU activates derating when specified inverter FaultCode AND BMS temp errors present.
Derating triggers after errors persist 5 s; if still present after 15 s remains active until key cycle.
VCU monitors FaultCode via InvFault1/InvFault2 for Turtle Mode.
VCU reads BMS FRAME 3 soc for Turtle Mode logic.
VCU monitors BMS FRAME 1 errors for Turtle Mode.
Activates if inverter or BMS error 5 s or SoC < 10 %.
Error must persist 5 s to trigger; mode stays active if error persists 15 s; clears after error free for 2 s.
VCU shall send Message2 to CasaliniDashboard on CAN1 per latest DBC.
VCU sets Motor Traction Fault indicator active if specified InvFault codes persist 5 s.
If error persists 15 s indicator stays active until key cycle; otherwise deactivates.
VCU sets Powertrain Fault indicator active if any FaultCode persists 5 s.
Same 15 s hold / 2 s clear logic as above.
Indicator active if specified BMS temp errors persist 5 s.
15 s hold logic; clears on key cycle or 2 s error free.
Indicator active if BMS FRAME 1 error persists 5 s.
15 s hold / 2 s clear logic.
Indicator active for BMS over/under charging temp errors 5 s.
15 s hold logic; clears on key cycle or 2 s error free.
